channel.title: Comments on: Google Reader not so great

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: <p>Regarding Bloglines, we are still trying to make it the best reader.</p>
item.content:encoded: Regarding Bloglines, we are still trying to make it the best reader.

item.title: By: Nicholas Baum
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Baum
item.description: <p>Hi Matt,</p><p>Actually we do have keyboard shortcuts:<br/><a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard"</a> rel="nofollow"><a href="http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard</a></a><br/>I'll be the first one to admit that they're kind of hard to find, buried deep in the help page.</p><p>I do appreciate the feedback, and rest assured that we're constantly working on improving the product.<br/>Cheers,</p><p>-Nick, Product Manager for Google Reader</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,

Actually we do have keyboard shortcuts:
http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard“ rel=”nofollow”>http://www.google.com/help/faq_reader.html#keyboard
I’ll be the first one to admit that they’re kind of hard to find, buried deep in the help page.

I do appreciate the feedback, and rest assured that we’re constantly working on improving the product.
Cheers,

-Nick, Product Manager for Google Reader

item.title: By: Chad Schelfhout
item.dc:creator: Chad Schelfhout
item.description: <p>I had the same experience with Google Reader, but moved back to bloglines very quickly. s & j are used all the time. I would like to see one more addtional shortcut key to move to next unread article. I even submitted the request to bloglines but no real response.<img src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif"</a>> </p>
item.content:encoded: I had the same experience with Google Reader, but moved back to bloglines very quickly. s & j are used all the time. I would like to see one more addtional shortcut key to move to next unread article. I even submitted the request to bloglines but no real response.http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GHL/$FILE/sad.gif“>
